result.execSummary:
The defendant Malik Terez Randle was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
TIME SERVED. With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same. 

Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Jail for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice.

Financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of $50 per month commencing December 1, 2022 or judgment shall enter for nonpayment. There is a $15 administrative fee for any payment plan and any change to a payment plan. The fee will be added to the first payment. If not paid, a judgment shall be entered.  Defendant shall reimburse the Clerk of Courts for attorney fees as previously ordered or judgment shall be entered.

Financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of $50 per month commencing December 1, 2022 or judgment shall enter for nonpayment.  There is a $15 administrative fee for any payment plan and any change to a payment plan. The fee will be added to the first payment. If not paid, a judgment shall be entered. Defendant shall reimburse the Clerk of Courts for attorney fees as previously ordered or judgment shall be entered.

Prosecuting attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Malik Terez Randle in court, in custody.  Attorney Edgar A Beltran in court for Malik Terez Randle. Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. Court informs Defendant of DNA expungement rights. Def does not qualify for SPD and req court appointed counsel.  Court appoints Atty Leech.  Defendant shall reimburse Washington County at a rate of $50 per month commencing 8-15-22. Court sets $1000 cash bond.  Court enters NG pleas on behalf of def.  Adjourned to allow defendant to appear with an attorney.
